availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Adam Kerr (Portsmouth, Ohio, mayor and ironworker)

body.p: Portsmouth, Ohio, mayor and ironworker. Pennsylvania native. Married to Lucinda Kerr in Scioto County, Ohio, on December 26, 1837. Father of James H. Kerr, A. Eliza Kerr, Isabell Kerr, and Jane Kerr. Member of the Democratic Party. Ironworker in Portsmouth in 1850. Mayor of Portsmouth from 1853 to 1855. Mayor of Portsmouth from 1859 to 1865. Ironwork in Portsmouth in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Scioto County, Portsmouth, p. 220B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Scioto County, Census, p. 450.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Greene County Marriages, Film #000292694, p. 235.
N. W. Evans, A History of Scioto County, Ohio: Together with a Pioneer Record of Southern Ohio (Portsmouth, Ohio: Nelson W. Evans, 1903), 617-8.
"Adam Kerr (1810-1878)," Find A Grave, Memorial #52225399, accessed May 19, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/52225399.
